content.description:
The farthest left climb on the wall, slightly away from the other three. A good warm up for the other three.

Climbs white rock using all sort of handholds. It's slabby for most of the climb only barely reaching vertical at the bottom.

It's called whispering voices because when it was bolted, I kept hearing voices, but couldn't figure out where the were coming from.  Once I got to the top, I realized there were people on Kentucky Fried Penguin, that I could hear.
content.location: Start on the low angle slope of weird reddish brownish rock til you get to the first bolt.  The route continues up past a huge hueco to two anchors with quicklinks.

content.description:
A good climb using crimps and little edges, with some good jugs to shake out on.

Climbs the flaky white rock til you get a good rest at the ledge.  Get ready for some high feet and big moves. Enjoy the exposure.

Clipping the chains is a little tricky, save some juice or enjoy the (safe) fall.
content.location: Starts just to the left of a little cave and follows the arete up to chains.

content.description:
Super fun route with lots of big moves on overhanging rock.

Starts with easy climbing to the shelf, and gets fun after that.  Big holds abound down low, but get increasingly smaller the higher you get.  Extremely fun movement on excellent rock.

The top out is the crux.  Once you clip the last bolt, the holds seem to disappear.  Once you figure out the beta, the small holds you have to use are good.
content.location: Shares first bolt with 3.14, but climbs left to the overhanging face.

content.description:
Good climb with plenty of features.

The crux is getting above the shelf.  You can clip the bolt and down climb and get a better rest on the shelf.

Once you're ready to commit to using the pinch crimp, fully commit and work your feet.  The holds are all there and they are all good.
content.location:
Farthest right route.  Shares the first bolt with

Advanced Dynamics

then veers right
